messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Audio recordings from Live and Learn
messages.msgSnippet: To download an mp3 ...  right click, save to your computer and then load it onto your mp3 player. (if you have one) I listen to Sandra s peaceful parenting
messages.messageBody:
To download an mp3 ... right click, save to your computer and then
load it onto your mp3 player. (if you have one)

I listen to Sandra's peaceful parenting talk on the treadmill sometimes.

Lauren

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Audio recordings from Live and Learn
messages.msgSnippet: Do you have access to a friend with a jumpdrive and a cd burner?? you can transfer the mp3 format easily that way :) or borrow an mp3 player?? (they re getting
messages.messageBody:
Do you have access to a friend with a jumpdrive and a cd burner??
you can transfer the mp3 format easily that way :) or borrow an mp3 player??
(they're getting cheaper and cheaper...)

I too find the message best delivered on a long drive :D

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Audio recordings from Live and Learn
messages.msgSnippet: ... I use Audio Hijack to record anything I can play on my computer. It can put anything I record into MP3 format so I can put it on my iPod or burn a cd.
messages.messageBody:
On Mar 23, 2008, at 7:36 PM, Jennifer Varela wrote:

> I wish I had a way to record it so that I could
> listen to it somewhere besides while I was sitting at my computer.

I use "Audio Hijack" to record anything I can play on my computer. It
can put anything I record into MP3 format so I can put it on my iPod
or burn a cd.

That might be a Mac-only program - I'm not sure. But, if so, there is
probably something equivalent for PCs.

-pam

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Audio recordings from Live and Learn
messages.msgSnippet: ... I saw you recommend that before and I listened to it twice already!  I really liked that talk!   I wish I had a way to record it so that I could listen to
messages.messageBody:
>
> >>>And don't forget the Parenting Peacefully talk is available **For
> FREE** at
> the bottom of this page: http://sandradodd.com/parentingpeacefully
> (really, really, the BEST $7 I ever invested in ME and my parenting-- have
> I
> said that already? ::bwg::)
> --
> ~diana :)<<


I saw you recommend that before and I listened to it twice already! I
really liked that talk! I wish I had a way to record it so that I could
listen to it somewhere besides while I was sitting at my computer. I also am
really interested in the Mindful Parenting one with Ren and Sandra from 2005
and there is one called Flow that's by Sandra that I'd like to listen to. I
kept reading about the downloads and I wanted to hear so many of them!
Heck, if I had the money, I'd order the entire conference! I have dial up
internet and so it takes forever to download any of the talks, but, totally
worth it if I could record it onto something (I *really* like listening to
them in the car).

Jen


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.msgSnippet: ... That was gonna be my suggestion :) And don t forget the Parenting Peacefully talk is available **For FREE** at the bottom of this page:
messages.messageBody:
On Sun, Mar 23, 2008 at 7:13 AM, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:

> -=-I keep finding MP3 Downloads for these talks, does anyone know if
> there are
> any talks available to order on CD?-=-
>
> There were for St. Louis, but I didn't find those for sale anymore.
>
> You could download the MP3 and put it on a CD yourself?
>
>

That was gonna be my suggestion :)
And don't forget the Parenting Peacefully talk is available **For FREE** at
the bottom of this page: http://sandradodd.com/parentingpeacefully
(really, really, the BEST $7 I ever invested in ME and my parenting-- have I
said that already? ::bwg::)
--
~diana :)
xoxoxoxo
hannahbearski.blogspot.com

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Audio recordings from Live and Learn
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/23/2008 5:39:36 P.M. Eastern Standard Time, kel9769@yahoo.com writes: As  well, wondering if anyone has any experience with the Not Back
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/23/2008 5:39:36 P.M. Eastern Standard Time,
kel9769@... writes:

As well, wondering if anyone has any experience with the "Not Back to
> School Camp" put on by Llewellyn??



Both my kids have had such positive experiences at NBTSC. They are now 15
and 18. My oldest daughter went to 4 camp sessions on the east coast. She'll
be in college this year but my son plans on attending the session in Vermont
in September.

My daughter would be very happy to share some of her experiences at camp if
you would like to write to me off-list. From listening to the stories they
have told after coming home from camp, the first words that come to mind are
empowering and life-changing. All good stuff from our perspective.

Gail









**************Create a Home Theater Like the Pros. Watch the video on AOL

(http://home.aol.com/diy/home-improvement-eric-stromer?video=15?ncid=aolhom00030000000001)

messages.subject: Re: Audio recordings from Live and Learn
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hi Kelley My daughter went to the Vermont session of NBTSC last year and had an amazing time.  It was a great experience for her.  She said it was nothing
messages.messageBody:
>
> As well, wondering if anyone has any experience with the "Not Back to
> School Camp" put on by Llewellyn??
>
> Thank you!
> Kelley
>

Hi Kelley
My daughter went to the Vermont session of NBTSC last year and had an
amazing time. It was a great experience for her. She said it was
nothing like she thought it would be but better than she could have
imagined. She is planning on going back this year and is really
looking forward to it.
Kelly

messages.subject: Audio recordings from Live and Learn
messages.msgSnippet: I have heard mentioned that Sandra and other greats have some audio recordings from a Live and Learn week that are very inspirational.  I have looked for the
messages.messageBody:
I have heard mentioned that Sandra and other greats have some audio
recordings from a Live and Learn week that are very inspirational. I
have looked for the links to these but cannot seem to find them. I
would love it if someone could share the link or point me in the right
direction!

As well, wondering if anyone has any experience with the "Not Back to
School Camp" put on by Llewellyn??

Thank you!
Kelley
